FuncDef: This command enables the TCP maximum segment size (MSS) adjustments in a MAP domain. The TCP SYN and SYN-ACK packets are intercepted in both directions, and if their MSS value is larger than the one configured using this command, the MSS value in the packet is re-written (lowered) to the configured value. The end hosts use the lowest setting of the two hosts. The MSS value does not account for the IP or TCP header length.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the maximum size of the segment. Values-160 to 8626.
